proDescription.sound_description: Aggressive and tight with pronounced midrange, moderate brightness, and defined attack. The tone is thick and powerful, but not overly saturated. Sustain and clarity are important, with moderate compression and a touch of warmth.

Amplifier: British-style high-gain tube amp head (Marshall-type), providing the main distortion and character. 5. Cabinet: 4x12 closed-back cabinet with Celestion-style speakers for punch and presence. 6. EQ: Graphic or parametric EQ in the loop or after amp to shape mids (boost), slightly cut highs if too harsh, and tighten lows. 7. Modulation: Not used. 8. Delay: Not used. 9. Reverb: Subtle spring or room reverb for natural space, but kept low in the mix.

proDescription.guitar_rig_description: Noise gate: not used (signal is clean and controlled; noise is not an issue). Compressor: not used (dynamic playing is preserved for a natural feel). Overdrive/Boost: light overdrive or boost pedal (optional, used to push the amp slightly for extra bite and sustain). Amplifier: classic British-style tube amp set to edge-of-breakup/crunch (e.g., Marshall Plexi or JCM800), providing the main character of the tone. Cabinet: 4x12 closed-back cabinet with vintage-style speakers (e.g., Celestion Greenbacks), contributing to the punchy and focused sound. EQ: amp and/or pedal EQ set for a pronounced midrange, tight bass, and clear but not harsh treble. Modulation: not used (tone remains dry and direct). Delay: not used. Reverb: subtle spring reverb (optional, just to add a touch of space without washing out the dry attack).
proDescription.additional_info: Use a solid-body guitar (e.g., Gibson SG or Les Paul), bridge pickup engaged, and play with strong, percussive right-hand attack. Medium gauge strings (e.g., 10-46) recommended for punch and sustain. Avoid excessive gain; the tone should be crunchy but articulate, letting chords ring clearly.

pedalboard: MXR M133 Micro Amp (set Level at 11–12 o’clock for subtle boost; optional, only if extra bite is needed)
Reverb: Add via amp’s onboard spring reverb or use Boss RV-6 (set to Spring, Level at 8–9 o’clock, Tone at 10 o’clock, minimal Decay)
realRig.cabinet: Marshall 1960AX 4x12 with Celestion G12M Greenback speakers

versions.prompt: Ac dc back in black Intro

proDescription.sound_description: Clean, slightly compressed tone with chime and clarity, mild warmth, not overly bright, rich in dynamics, slight touch of ambience for spatial depth.
proDescription.guitar_rig_description: Noise gate: not used (signal is clean and dynamics are important). Compressor: used for subtle dynamic leveling and slight sustain, keeping attack natural. Overdrive/distortion/boost: not used (clean tone). Amplifier: clean channel of a Fender-style tube amp for bright, glassy cleans with a bit of warmth. Cabinet: 2x12 open-back cabinet to enhance airy high-end and chime. EQ: applied for mild mid-scoop and to roll off harsh highs. Modulation: not used. Delay: not used. Reverb: used moderately for a touch of room ambience, giving space without washing out the tone.
references: Red Hot Chili Peppers - Scar Tissue
John Frusciante - Live at Slane Castle (Scar Tissue intro)
proDescription.additional_info: Strat-style guitar with single-coil pickups is preferred. Light to medium string gauge (e.g., .010-.046). Play with fingers or pick for soft attack. Let notes ring and use slides for phrasing, mimicking John Frusciante's touch.

realRig.cabinet: Fender 212 Enclosure with 2x12" Jensen C12K speakers (open-back)

proDescription.sound_description: Tight, aggressive, and percussive high-gain rhythm guitar tone with pronounced low end, focused mids, and controlled high frequencies. The tone is very dry with minimal ambience, featuring a fast attack and palm-muted chug, while remaining clear and articulate under heavy distortion.
proDescription.guitar_rig_description: 1. Noise Gate: Used at the front of the chain to eliminate unwanted string and amplifier noise, ensuring tight stops and starts. 2. Compressor: Not used, as dynamics should remain natural and punchy. 3. Overdrive/Distortion: A high-gain distortion pedal or amp's lead channel used to provide saturated metal rhythm crunch, with clarity and minimal muddiness. 4. Amplifier: Modern high-gain tube amp model, tight bass response, focused mids, and controlled treble for aggressive rhythm playing. 5. Cabinet: 4x12 closed-back cabinet with V30-style speakers, mic'd close for tightness and punch. 6. EQ: Used post-amp to slightly cut low-mids and high frequencies, and to tighten up the low end. 7. Modulation: Not used, as the tone is kept dry and direct. 8. Delay: Not used, to preserve the dry and immediate character. 9. Reverb: Not used, as the recording and live tone are both very dry and focused.
proDescription.additional_info: Use a guitar with active pickups (such as EMG 81) or high-output passives for tightness and clarity. Use heavy gauge strings for increased tension and attack. Play with strong palm muting to accentuate the percussive character. Down-tuned to Drop D or Drop C# depending on live arrangement.

realRig.cabinet: Mesa/Boogie Rectifier Standard 4x12 with Celestion Vintage 30 speakers

generations.originalPrompt: As I Lay Dying Throught Striggle Main Riff

proDescription.tone_title: As I Lay Dying - Through Struggle Main Riff
proDescription.sound_description: Tight, aggressive, and modern high-gain tone with pronounced attack, solid low end, scooped mids, and a bright top end. The sound is highly articulate for fast palm-muted riffs, with controlled noise and a percussive punch.
proDescription.guitar_rig_description: 1. Noise gate: Used to keep the high-gain signal tight and eliminate unwanted feedback or string noise between chugs. 2. Compressor: Not used, as the high-gain amp provides natural compression. 3. Overdrive/boost: Placed before the amp, typically a classic overdrive pedal with low drive and high level to tighten the low end and add clarity to pick attack. 4. Amplifier: Modern high-gain tube amp (e.g., Peavey 5150/6505 or Mesa/Boogie Dual Rectifier) set for aggressive distortion, tight bass, and crisp highs. 5. Cabinet: 4x12 closed-back cab with high-power speakers (e.g., Celestion V30s) for punch and definition. 6. EQ: Graphic EQ in the effects loop or post-amp to further sculpt a scooped midrange and refine bass/tremble response. 7. Modulation: Not used. 8. Delay: Not used. 9. Reverb: Not used.
references: As I Lay Dying - Through Struggle
proDescription.additional_info: Pick attack and palm-muting are crucial for articulation. Use medium to heavy gauge strings for tightness (e.g., 10-52 or 11-54), and tune down to Drop C as per the original recording. Use a pick with a sharp tip for clarity.

realRig.cabinet: Mesa/Boogie Rectifier Standard 4x12 with Celestion Vintage 30 speakers
